# 1987–88 Golden State Warriors season

The 1987–88 Golden State Warriors season was the Warriors' 42nd season in the NBA and 25th in the San Francisco Bay Area. Head coach George Karl resigned with 18 games left,[https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=BChVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=aI8DAAAAIBAJ&pg=3534,9078435&dq=george+karl+resigned+warriors&hl=en Ellensburg Daily Record – Google News Archive Search] and Ed Gregory was interim head coach for the rest of the season. The Warriors finished fifth in the Pacific Division with a disappointing 20–62 record.
